resources.string: Portes de Bois-Éden
Chassez les dryades de la Terrasse de Tarrthail et les aliénés des plaies de l'Étable d'Afallach. Retournez ensuite voir l'argonaute Ellwood à la Bois-Éden.
« D'où vient le dépérissement ? »

Eh bien, c'est la question que tout le monde se pose ! Bois-Éden est le lieu d'une puissante magie naturelle, c'est l'ancien territoire de la Terre enragée. \n\nSi le dépérissement arrive à se propager aussi vite, même ici, il est possible que rien ne puisse l'arrêter.
« Est-ce lié à l'altération ? »

Ce ne sont pas les théories qui manquent, mais je préfère les faits. Vous pouvez m'aider à en trouver ? \n\nJ'ai besoin que vous préleviez quelques échantillons sur les dryades et les aliénés des plaies. Ce sera au moins un premier pas.
Les dryades de la Terre enragée sont déjà très dangereuses, mais le dépérissement les a rendues pires encore.\n\nEssayez de revenir en un seul morceau.

Merci, cela fera parfaitement l'affaire. \n\nÇa fait bizarre de venir en aide à la Terre enragée. Mon ancien instructeur m'aurait reproché de sympathiser avec l'ennemi plutôt que de tirer avantage de la situation.
« Pourquoi combattez-vous la Terre enragée ? »

Pour survivre, camarade. Les humains vivants ont toujours été l'espèce la plus menacée en Aeternum. \n\nPour ma part, je préférerais trouver un moyen de vivre en harmonie avec la nature. Mais la Terre enragée est... enragée.
Éliminer les dryades sur la route longeant la Terrasse de Tarrthail
Vaincre {targetName} à la Terrasse de Tarrthail
Éliminez les aliénés des plaies à : {POITags}
Vaincre : {targetName} à : {POITags}
La teinture c'est la santé
Fabriquer ou se procurer de la teinture mère de dépérissement concentrée, puis retournez voir l'argonaute Ellwood, à Bois-Éden.
« Cela devrait vous rapprocher, non ? »

Je le croyais aussi. Certaines dryades semblaient amicales, mais après l'apparition du dépérissement, la communication a été rompue.\n\nSi nous purgeons le dépérissement du bois, elles devraient revenir... enfin j'espère.
« Comment faire pour s'en débarrasser, alors ? »

Je vais étudier les échantillons que vous m'avez ramenés. En attendant, vous devriez apprendre à vous protéger contre les effets du dépérissement.\n\nUtilisez cette recette pour fabriquer une solution protectrice, puis revenez me voir.
Si vous n'avez pas les ressources suffisantes pour fabriquer une teinture mère de dépérissement, vous devrez les réunir ou les acheter au comptoir.

Ah, oui. Beau travail ! Cela peut vous épargner de grandes souffrances.\n\nPlus d'une personne est arrivée à l'avant-poste couverte de mycètes rouges. Ces malheureux perdent leurs forces et implorent de mourir.
« Qu'est-ce qui leur arrive ? »

Nous allons exaucer leur souhait. Que pouvons-nous faire d'autre ? Ils meurent, et ne semblent pas ressusciter.\n\nJe crains que leur véritable destin soit plus sombre que la mort, mais parlons d'autre chose. Simplement... utilisez la teinture mère judicieusement.
Fabriquer ou récupérer : {itemName}
La peste soit sur eux
Éliminez Denmen au sommet de la tour de Tor Fearg et ramenez ses restes à Ellwood, à Bois-Éden.
« Où puis-je en trouver ? »

Il y a une tour du nom de Tor Fearg. La tour elle-même est devenue viciée, mais certaines créatures à l'intérieur ont résisté. \n\nVous y trouverez notamment une dryade du nom de « Denmen ». Ramenez-moi des prélèvements de ses lianes si vous le pouvez.
La tour représente un véritable défi, et les dryades sont redoutables. \n\nFaites preuve de prudence lors de votre ascension : Denmen sera la créature la plus puissante que vous affronterez.

Ah, en effet, c'est un beau spécimen. Le bois et la terre qui composent les lianes de Denmen sont imprégnés de vieil Azoth.\n\nCela confirme ma théorie. Saviez-vous que Bois-Éden est la source de la Terre enragée en Aeternum ?
« Vous voulez dire qu'ils sont nés ici ? »

Oui, ils sont ici chez eux. Je pense que les nouveau-nés de la Terre enragée sont plus sensibles au dépérissement.\n\nLes créatures plus âgées comme Denmen sont plus aptes à résister. Mais sans plus de données, cela ne reste qu'une théorie...
Vaincre Denmen au sommet de la tour à : {POITags}
Vaincre les soldates dryades à : {POITags}
Vaincre : {targetname} au sommet de la tour pour obtenir : {itemName}
La force de la terre
Allez dans les ruines du Charme de Finnabair et enquêtez sur le dépérissement qui s'y cache. Retournez ensuite voir l'argonaute Ellwood à la Bois-Éden.
« Quel est le lien ? »

Je ne sais pas encore. Il y a une nouvelle poussée de dépérissement au plus profond des Chutes élyséennes, au Charme de Finnabair.\n\nLes dryades qui s'y trouvent sont âgées et aguerries, et il se pourrait qu'elles soient capables d'y résister... du moins, pour le moment.
« Vous voulez que j'y aille ? »

Oui, et méfiez-vous. Même si elles ne sont pas viciées, les dryades vous considéreront comme leur adversaire. \n\nMais qui dit nouvelle épidémie dit nouveaux prélèvements ! Plus les échantillons seront frais, plus ils pourront en dire long sur les origines du dépérissement.
Nous ne sommes pas les véritables ennemis des dryades, mais elles ne font pas de distinction. \n\nVous devrez sans doute les combattre lorsque vous irez collecter ces échantillons de dépérissement.

Ainsi les dryades du Charme de Finnabair tiennent bon ? Parfait. Ça confirme ma théorie.\n\nVoyons voir ces échantillons fraîchement prélevés alors... hmmm. Oh. Celui-ci provient d'une vieille pousse, et pourtant il est toujours infecté...
« Est-ce que cela infirme votre théorie ? »
C'est pour le moins incompatible, oui. Si ce n'est pas l'âge du spécimen qui détermine sa vulnérabilité au dépérissement, alors qu'est-ce que c'est ? \n\nJe... Je dois y réfléchir.
Enquêter sur le dépérissement à : {POITags}
Vaincre les soldates dryades à : {POITags}
Vaincre les aliénés des plaies pour obtenir un échantillon de dépérissement
Bâton dans les roues
Sapez le moral des mineurs altérés au Gouffre de Grimman en prenant d'assaut leurs ressources et en éliminant certains d'entre eux. Retournez ensuite voir le protecteur Ducquet à Bois-Éden.
« Et pourquoi ça ? »
Nous attendons une opportunité, bien entendu. Votre arrivée, par exemple.\n\nCela semble être le bon moment, si vous vous sentez capable de mener la charge.
« C'est dans mes cordes. »

Parfait. Les altérés ont installé des campements dans les mines du Gouffre de Grimman.\n\nAttaquez leurs positions là-bas, désarmez-les si vous le pouvez, et nous connaîtrons bientôt leurs points forts.
Avez-vous pu vous rendre au Gouffre de Grimman ? Les aliénés pensent que se cacher dans les rochers les protégera. \n\nIls vont bientôt se rendre compte que non, pas vrai ?

Victoire ! Vous combattez comme personne ! Attaquez leurs campements et frappez sans pitié ! \n\nPeut-être que cela ralentira leur chaîne d'approvisionnement en provenance de la grande Faille et de la Montagne du Haut-Chaos.
Saper le moral des mineurs altérés au Gouffre de Grimman
Vaincre : {targetName} au Gouffre de Grimman
Piller : {itemName} dans les coffres au Gouffre de Grimman
Guillotiner le garde, crever le contremaître
Éliminez Philippe le Garde d'élite et le contremaître Harold au Gouffre de Grimman. Retournez ensuite voir le protecteur Ducquet à Bois-Éden.
« Cela me semble être un bon plan. »
Parfait. Les pisteurs ont identifié les commandants : Philippe, le Garde d'élite, et Robertson, le contremaître.\n\nÉliminez ces deux-là, et tous les altérés de Bois-Éden prendront peur.
Les pisteurs prétendent que Philippe et Robertson dirigent les opérations depuis l'intérieur de la mine. Bonne chance.
Coupez la tête pensante, le reste du corps suivra ! Avec ces deux-là en moins, leurs opérations vont se retrouver à l'arrêt. \n\nCela devrait amener les altérés à remettre en question leur stratégie.
Vaincre le contremaître à : {POITags}
Vaincre le Garde d'élite à : {POITags}
Vaincre : {targetName} à : {POITags}
Vaincre : {targetName} à : {POITags}
En aval de la voie d'Eaux-Fétides
Parlez à Aulus Fulvius à Eaux-Fétides.
« Je peux transmettre votre message. »

Vraiment ? Formidable ! Cependant, il y a un peu de distance à parcourir. Mais... Si vous voulez bien...\n\nCe message est pour le magistrat local, le légat Fulvius. Il a besoin de vous, ça, j'en suis certain. Alors, marchez d'un pied léger.
Il suffit de se diriger vers le sud et d'entamer... un long, un très long voyage, vraiment. Assurez-vous d'avoir suffisamment de vivres pour la route.

Qu'est-ce que c'est, au juste ? Un message de Bois-Éden ? Je n'en connais pas beaucoup qui pourraient faire un tel voyage sans encombre. Considérez que je suis impressionné.\n\nPuisque vous êtes là, je pense que je vais faire appel à vos talents.
Lumières vacillantes
Enquêtez sur les gardiens anciens et leurs déplacements dans le Lac primal Retournez ensuite voir le pisteur Wardell à Bois-Éden.
« En quoi les gardiens sont-ils une menace ? »
Eh bien, dans la plupart des territoires, ils sont chargés de sécuriser certaines ruines...\n\nIci, cependant, il semble qu'ils soient chargés de protéger tout Bois-Éden.
« Ils veulent que nous partions ? »

Oh, ça oui. Nous, pisteurs, les combattons depuis des années. \n\nJe crains qu'avec toute l'attention que nous avons portée aux altérés et au dépérissement, nous les ayons laissés regagner du terrain.
« Je peux faire quelque chose ? »
En effet, les gardiens lancent généralement leurs attaques depuis un endroit nommé le Lac primal.\n\nSi votre proposition tient toujours, alors attaquez-les là-bas et affaiblissez leurs troupes.
Il fut un temps où les Anciens considéraient ce territoire comme étant exclusivement le leur.\n\nLes gardiens semblent toujours déterminés à faire respecter ce principe.

Ah mais vous voilà ! J'espère que vous leur avez porté un coup dont ils ne se remettront pas de sitôt.\n\nLa dernière chose dont nous avons besoin en ce moment, c'est de subir une attaque des gardiens anciens.
« Vous êtes tranquilles pour un moment. »

Ils ont repris leur patrouille, alors. C'est amusant, n'est-ce pas ? Le fait que ma mission soit la même que la leur.\n\nEst-ce qu'un jour, moi aussi, je perdrai tout sauf mes os, pour accomplir mon devoir ? Je suppose que de telles questions philosophiques sont vaines, lorsque le devoir subsiste.
Repousser la menace des gardiens anciens à : {POITags}
Vaincre les gardiens anciens
Larmes d'azur
Récupérez des larmes d'aléa sur les soldates dryades dans la zone des Torsades d'aléa. Retournez ensuite voir le pisteur Wardell à Bois-Éden.
« Votre validation m'honore. »

C'est mérité, alors écoutez bien. Bois-Éden regorge d'arbres d'aléa, qui ont une belle lueur. \n\nLa sève de ces arbres peut être transformée en ce que nous appelons les larmes d'aléa, un produit sacré pour les pisteurs.
« À quoi servent-elles ? »

Ces larmes sont bonnes pour la santé, mais à vrai dire, nous ne les transformons pas nous-mêmes.\n\nNotre secret est que nous les obtenons en combattant les dryades des Torsades d'aléa. Récupérez-en quelques-unes et je vous récompenserai.
La collecte des larmes aidera les pisteurs dans la nature. \n\nVous nous accordez une grande faveur.
Ah, ces Larmes m'ont sauvé la vie plus souvent qu'à mon tour...\n\nElles seront très appréciées par les autres pisteurs, également. Une fois de plus, nous avons une dette envers vous.
« C'est un plaisir d'aider les pisteurs. »

Nous sommes des murmures dans la forêt, des yeux dans l'ombre... Vous ne nous voyez peut-être pas, mais nous surveillons vos arrières.\n\nJ'espère que vous apprécierez notre aide comme nous avons apprécié la vôtre.
Récupérer des larmes d'aléa sur les soldates dryades de : {POITags}
Vaincre les soldates dryades pour obtenir : {itemName}
Nord-est d'Éden
Retrouvez Ellwood, l'argonaute, à l'avant-poste au nord-est de Bois-Éden.
« Qu'a-t-il dit ? »

Il était assez pressé. Sa mission visant à lutter contre le dépérissement l'a amené à l'avant-poste, au nord-est.\n\nIl a demandé à ce que vous le retrouviez là-bas. Je lui ai dit que je transmettrais le message, et c'est ce que j'ai fait.
Le voyage vers le nord-est sera difficile. Ça, je peux vous le garantir.
Ah, je vois que vous avez survécu au voyage. Je suis heureux de vous voir.\n\nPardonnez mon empressement, mais je crois que nous trouverons les réponses que nous cherchons, ici, au nord-est.
Migration malade
Allez à la Couronne brisée pour enquêter sur la propagation du dépérissement au-delà de Bois-Éden.
« Le dépérissement a un but ? »
Oui, c'est ma théorie ! \n\nLe dépérissement est apparemment une menace pour toutes les formes de vie, mais si c'était là tout son intérêt ? Et si c'était en fait un mécanisme d'autodéfense ?
« Vous voulez dire que c'est naturel ? »

Exactement. Nous savons qu'il a infecté Bois-Éden, mais où d'autre s'est-il répandu ? \n\nÀ la Montagne du Haut-Chaos, je suppose. Si vous le voulez bien, rendez-vous à la Couronne brisée et au col de Fierna pour vous en assurer.
Au-delà du col se trouve la Montagne du Haut-Chaos, où, m'a-t-on dit, les altérés se sont rassemblés en grand nombre. \n\nSi vous décidez de vous y rendre, prenez les dispositions nécessaires.
Alors vous l'avez confirmé, non ? Le dépérissement s'étend vers la Montagne du Haut-Chaos.\n\nLa dernière question qui subsiste est la suivante : comment le dépérissement affecte-t-il les altérés ?
« Je n'ai pas vu le moindre altéré. »
Ah ha ! Je l'aurais parié ! C'est une menace pour les altérés autant que pour le reste d'entre nous.\n\nLe dépérissement est une tentative d'Aeternum de combattre l'altération.
« Alors c'est de la légitime défense ? »

Oui, tout à fait. Le territoire tout entier doit faire un ultime effort pour se purger du poison de l'altération. \n\nMais ce remède tuera tous les êtres vivants d'Aeternum. Nous devons neutraliser le poison nous-mêmes avant que cela n'arrive.
Enquêter sur la présence de dépérissement à : {POITags}
Vaincre les troupes de la Terre enragée à : {POITags}
Menace de mort (Élite)
La guetteuse Lin vous a demandé de trouver une clé pour entrer dans les bois de Zygoramet, et de détruire la dangereuse créature qui s'y trouve. Retournez ensuite voir la guetteuse Lin à Bois-Éden
« Pourquoi dites-vous cela ? »

Une naturaliste est venue ici il y a de cela quelques dizaines d'années puis elle a disparu après avoir été victime du dépérissement.\n\nElle avait découvert la présence en ces lieux d'un spécimen de la Terre enragée capable de se dupliquer un nombre de fois infini ... et ce, en un clin d'œil !
« Ici, à Bois-Éden ? »

Oui. Dès que l'altération aura disparu, cette créature se dupliquera jusqu'à ce qu'elle domine tout Aeternum. \n\nElle rôde dans les bois de Zygoramet, au sud. Fouillez les ruines qui s'y trouvent pour y trouver une clé, puis entrez dans la fissure et détruisez ce monstre. S'il vous plaît... vous devez me croire.
Je n'exagère pas. La monstruosité qui vit dans les bois de Zygoramet nous consumera tous.\n\nVous devez obtenir une clé pour y entrer et détruire cette créature.

Oh, vous revoilà ! La créature est donc morte ? Bon sang, vous êtes la première personne à me croire. \n\nLes gens ne le réalisent peut-être pas, mais nous sommes tous désormais un peu plus en sécurité.
« Vous êtes sûre qu'elle ne reviendra pas ? »
Pas du tout. En fait, je soupçonne même qu'elle le fera, étant donné ce que la naturaliste a dit. \n\nSi cette vile créature revient, il nous faudra la tuer de nouveau. Autant de fois que nécessaire.
Fouiller les ruines à : {POITags} pour y trouver une clé qui permet d'entrer dans les bois de Zygoramet
Vaincre : {targetName} pour récupérer : {itemName}
Entrer dans les bois de Zygoramet
Vaincre : {targetName}
Angoisse angoissante (Expédition)
Éliminez le gardien des verdures dans le Jardin de la Genèse. Retournez ensuite voir le pisteur Wardell à Bois-Éden.
« Le Jardin de la Genèse ? »

Oui, il s'agit de la pépinière sacrée de la Terre enragée, et quand ses créatures sont jeunes, elles sont particulièrement vulnérables.\n\nSi nous les aidons à protéger leurs petits dans le Jardin, nous parviendrons peut-être à une forme de compromis.
« Comment faire pour leur venir en aide ? »

Le Jardin est menacé par le dépérissement et un être connu sous le nom de gardien des verdures.\n\nÉliminez le gardien des verdures pour protéger la jeune flore et tentez ainsi de restaurer l'équilibre au sein du Jardin.

Le gardien des verdures n'est pas seulement une menace pour le Jardin, mais pour tout Aeternum. \n\nIl n'est que l'une des nombreuses manifestations du dépérissement. Nous devons libérer le Jardin de son emprise.

Ah ! Alors c'en est fini du gardien des verdures ? Sa plaie mettra des années à cicatriser, mais au moins la guérison a commencé.\n\nGrâce à vous, et à votre bravoure, il existe un espoir. Les pousses germeront à nouveau, et le cycle de la terre se poursuivra.
« Le cycle de la terre ? »

C'est un cycle qui nous dépasse tous, quelle que soit notre durée de vie. \n\nNous avons joué notre rôle dans le rétablissement du Jardin, et l'île peut maintenant entamer son processus de guérison. Je suis fier de vous.
Slag the Mines
Wreak havoc on the Slag Mines operations by burning key operational equipment and recover a set of survey notes for Foreman Gowering.
"It must feel awful, starting from nothing."

Start over? To hell with THAT idea. No. In theory I can make more coin. What I can't replace is my dignity.\n\nI'll play it straight with you. If I can't have this mine and all its riches, no one can.
"So… revenge, then?"
Oh, aye. Absolutely. First, I need you to recover the results of a survey I did. Not something I want in the hands of the Corrupted.\n\nFor the rest? Here's a torch. Burn. It. Down.
I want to see smoke on the horizon. I want to hear them screaming.

I see the smoke on the horizon. Warms a soul, it does.\n\nIt doesn't balance my ledger, but at this point I don't think anything will. I'm a well and truly ruined man. Maybe I'll take up lumberjacking.
"What about the survey?"
This? I'm inclined to tear it up. Or keep it for a souvenir. Either way, it's useless.\n\nHere's my last coin, more a keepsake at this point… not even enough to buy bread.
Storm into {POITags} and disrupt their operations
Recover the {itemName}
Disrupt the Slag Mines Operations
Burn the forge
Destroy supply lines
Burn Tents
Burn the Sawmill
Burying the Lead
Find the entrance of the underground chamber in the Upper Slag Mines. Bury it in rubble so the Corrupted cannot access the contents of the chamber.
"'It' being the contents of the survey?"
Just so. If my equipment worked and my surveyor is to be trusted, it was the entrance to a massive underground chamber. Ideally full of treasure.\n\nThe Corrupted CANNOT have it. Is that clear?
I'm proper pleased that we have this understanding. Let me know when you've rescinded their invitation to invade my cavern.

Oh, I heard. A fine collapse! Did you take the rest of the mine with it?

Probably not, but a man can dream of a sweeter revenge.

I already gave you my last coin, but here. A little keepsake of your own.
Enter {POITags} and bury Foreman Gowering's discovery
Strike the scaffolding to weaken the structure
Strike the final blow to bury the ancient door
Parted in Anger
Speak to members of the Cult of Renewal to learn what happened to Han Fang's daughter, Han Liu.
"Is someone missing?"

How embarrassing. Yes.\n\nThis is all so personal, and you a total stranger, but my daughter Han Liu has vanished. She was invited to share a meal with some strangers in white robes and simply did not come home.
"White robes? What are they, a cult?"

I do not know what they are, but when I asked about her, they turned me away. They seem to think I will "interfere with her journey".\n\nMaybe they will speak to you. I just want to know that she is safe.
I know I ask a great deal of you, stranger. You have my family's gratitude. Please bring my daughter back to me.
You return! Did they speak to you? I cannot fathom they would turn you away as well. You do not have that "hovering mother" look about you.
"I think you were right to be worried."
When I was young, I thought the notion of mother's intuition was pure superstition. But I was right… and it is a truly terrible feeling.\n\nI did not act, and now she is gone. Can she be saved?
Seek out the Cult of Renewal
Talk to Cultist Akech
Talk to Cultist Ylva
Talk to Cultist Jalair
Talk to High Seer Agnes
Share what you learned with Han Fang
The Cult of Renewal
Find Han Liu by joining her on the Cult of Renewal's so-called "Path of Truth."
"They mentioned a trial."
They would. How like a cult to both prevent me from speaking to her after she was in their clutches and then immediately send her away to prove herself.\n\nAnd how very like Liu to leap to impress…
"They said she might not return at all."

Why would they… she could die? She cannot even wield a sword.\n\nStranger, I do not know how to ask this of you, but you must save her. I do not care how. Lie to them. Follow her. Bring her back to me.
I only hope we are not too late.\n\nHeadstrong, foolish child…
I cannot tell you what a relief it is to see another on the road. I was truly beginning to worry I would need to continue on alone!
Talk to High Seer Agnes
Enter {POITags} in search of a sacred temple pool
Defeat {targetName} to protect Han Liu on her journey
Anoint the Seeds in the temple pool
Find Han Liu on the road
Walking Wyrds
Complete your own Path of Truth by planting an imbued seed at each of the Angry Earth shrines within the Wyrdwood Twists. Help Han Liu do the same by clearing the path of Angry Earth.
"At your mother's request, yes."
My mother? She truly cannot mind her own affairs, can she? This is MY choice. \n\nThose people were kind to me. All I want to do is learn more about them!
"I want to learn more about them, too."
I'm not sure I believe you, but would you help clear the road ahead? These creatures frighten me, I feel as if I have come as far as I can on my own.
I can climb well enough, but I am afraid I am rather useless in a fight. I hope for both our sakes that you are equipped to handle this.
Forgive me for being so cryptic before. This trial is certainly not for the faint of heart, but it does help us find those who truly think and feel as we do. I am eager to hear about your journey.
Follow the Path of Truth into the Wyrdwood Twists
Defeat {targetName} to protect Han Liu on her journey
Plant Seeds at Angry Earth Shrines
Plant a seed at Twisted Roots
Plant a seed at Sapterlith
Plant a seed at Beinn Creagg
Return to the enclave of the Cult of Renewal
Spoken Wyrds
Talk to Han Fang about taking the oath to officially join the Cult of Renewal.
"Have I not proven myself?"

You have, but in deed only. I have seen your commitment to understanding what it is we are doing here and it has been noted.\n\nBut here, we believe words hold power as well. Miss Liu has already spoken hers.
"Is there some sort of ceremony, then?"

Ah! Nothing so formal as that. This is but the first step you will take with us. There is a tome before the High Sage that contains the binding words that unite us.\n\nSpeak them to him, and we will call you ours.
The High Sage spoke those words to me when first we met. I felt them so stark, so prescient, that I saved them for all to come.

Welcome to the Cult of Renewal, my friend. I now name you Initiate, and soon all of our knowledge will be yours.\n\nEnjoy the grounds. Celebrate. Rest. You will be called upon when you are ready for the next step.
Relay this information to Han Fang
Stand before The High Sage
Take the Oath
A Sword in my Stead
Try to talk Han Liu out of undergoing a difficult rite and help her succeed if she insists on going anyway.
"What went wrong?"

She mentioned yet another trial, this time to one of those dryad-infested towers! I need not remind you how utterly defenseless she is!\n\nI pushed too hard to keep her here, to stop her. She told me to stay away.
"I can try and talk her out of it."

Would you? If you think it will work…\n\nI think we both know how this will end. If you can safeguard her as you did before, it will add to this considerable debt I owe you. Please go where I cannot, my friend.
What on Aeternum is this cult after? It feels to me as if they are trying to get their followers killed.\n\nOh Liu… why won't you listen?

What a triumph. In so little time both you and Miss Liu have not only demonstrated a willingness to learn, but also a deep, abiding respect for the denizens of Edengrove.\n\nFor this, we place our full trust in you.
Try to dissuade Han Liu
Ascend the tower {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Dryads to clear the way for Han Liu
Prove your worth by reaching the top of the tower and touching the Umbral Orb
Speak to High Seer Agnes at [PH]Cult Camp
One of Us
Venture to Buggane Hedge and harvest herbs for a calming tea from the hides of dryads.
"What happens after?"

Like myself and the High Sage, and the scores of Exalted, they will have gained the deepest, most complete understanding of our way of life. They will then go forth into Aeternum and tell others what they found.
"I take it Han Liu and I are not ready."

No, but I think bearing witness will prepare you.\n\nFor your part, there are some ruins to the north where dryads grow a specific herb on their bodies. Collect some for our rite-goers. That will help see them off.
I find a calming tea helps center them, opens their mind to the experience they are about to have.\n\nIt also helps reduce any mishaps with the denizens of the forest they are about to wander into.

This is a fine bundle of herbs. I hope you did not have a great deal of trouble acquiring them- it is a tricky task at best, and I have never met a dryad that gave them willingly.\n\nI will brew the tea, now.
Seek calming herbs from the denizens of {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Something to Celebrate
Venture into the verdant forests of Edengrove to harvest colorful flowers in celebration of the returning cultists.
"What happens if they do not return?"

Ah… I would prefer not to darken the mood with that discussion. I will, but not now. In this moment I would like to assume they will succeed. Can you procure some bright flowers, so we can make wreathes for them?
A find a nice flower wreathe to heighten any bright and cheerful moment. And their return shall be so!
You have a fine eye for color. Yes, these will do nicely. I will save the extras for another time, perhaps dry them. That seems appropriate.
Enter {POITags} and harvest colorful blooms
Harvest {itemName}
Waste Not, Want Not
Enter [forest name] and retrieve the fallen belongings of cultists who have failed their final rite.
"Is that it? They just… don't come back?"
Not as themselves, no. They likely still linger the forest in a more… lacking state. A soulless state, one could say.\n\nIf you want to see for yourself, there is more you can do.
"What can I do for them, now?"

Not for them. For us. Our cult grows every day. We must feed, clothe, and shelter all who come to us.\n\nThose who left us would want us to use their belongings for good. You can recover what they no longer need.
Everything we do is to strengthen the cult. No one individual rises above that goal. Not even myself. Not even the High Sage.
You went into the forest? Oh, this curiosity of mine is consuming! Tell me, tell me, what did you see? What happened to them?
"They are Lost, and we are stealing their gold."

Lost? Mindless… things?! How tragic!\n\nAnd what do you mean by 'stealing'? Do we not share all that we have? I can see how you might THINK that, but maybe you need to spend more time studying their ways.
Recover cultists' belongings from {POITags}
Gather {itemName}
[NYI] Subdue {targetName} for {itemName}
Deliver the recovered items to High Seer Agnes
Where You Go, I Will Follow
Help Han Fang reunite with Han Liu.
"I do not think she will leave them."

I think you are right. I have a terrible choice to make. I can continue to beg her to leave. She will push me away, perhaps forever. Or… I can let her be, and risk her enduring the same fate as the others.
"Or you could join them, like I did."

Join them? But the things they expect, the risks…

But I could be near her. I can care for her. I can hold her hand, even to an unspeakable end.

… And, perhaps, I can ease her away, but slowly. Over time.
"You should tell her."
I do not want to approach her now. She may think I am snooping again. Here. Give her this trinket. She will know what it means. It belonged to her father.
I hope she will hear me out, this time.
Why is my mother here? What did she say? I hope she does not mean to lecture me AGAIN.
"She wanted you to have this."

This belonged to my father. The inscription means "Where you go, I will follow." To give it to me now...\n\nI suppose it is time for my mother and I to have a long, honest talk. Thank you… for everything.
Dangling Out of Reach
Travel to Basalrot Bridge and collect mushrooms for Lilian.
"Mycophile?"
Ah, yes. Mushrooms. I love them. Finding them, classifying them, and of course tasting them. In stews, porridge, sautéed , and yes, raw.\n\nAh, my manners. You are quite busy, so! My request.
"Let me guess… mushrooms."

Haha, clairvoyance! I am no stranger to foraging in these harsh conditions, but the variety that I wish to sample are located out of my reach, atop a great crumbling bridge.\n\nNot a challenge for you, perhaps?
My mouth waters in anticipation. No matter how many I try, each is a delight unlike any other. I have come to crave it so!
What an interesting specimen you have found. I hope you used gloves. This ooze is suspect, no? \n\nAh well, I will boil these. That will rid them of this foulness. Ah, I cannot WAIT to taste.
"Is that a good idea? It's probably Blighted."

Your concern is noted, my friend. However! This is Aeternum!\n\nEven if these mushrooms are of a deadly variety, my soul will find my body again and I can continue as ever. So, no mushroom shall go untasted.
Forage for mushrooms from {POITags}
Collect {itemName} along the edges of the bridge
Symbiotic Delicacies
Venture to Mag Mell's Fancy to forage for mushrooms from the hides of Angry Earth dryads.
"That depends. What sort of mushrooms?"
I happened to be walking along the path to the west and noticed some rather unfriendly plant beings. As I was sprinting away, I noted they had mushrooms growing on their backs! I am terribly curious!
"About how they taste?"

Yes, but also no. Fungi are decomposers. But things do not die in the usual way here! How does a living being have mushrooms growing in their flesh?\n\nBring me some, and I will learn the answer. Then, I will eat!
My, how my stomach does roil. Is it hunger or toxic mushrooms? One of life's many mysteries.
A pile of haphazard journals and loose pages rests atop an empty foraging basket.
Forage for mushrooms from {POITags}
Slay {targetName} for {itemName}
A Quick Jaunt Into Death
Get a drink while you wait for Lilian to return.
[Drop off the mushrooms and read the note.]

My friend,

Those mushrooms were indeed poisonous. I am soon to die. In the meantime, I have an open tab at the inn. Enjoy a drink, relax, and I shall be with you momentarily.

- Lilian
A pile of haphazard journals and loose pages rests atop an empty foraging basket.
Did you enjoy your drink? I hope I did not worry you overly much.\n\nMushrooms and death, they do go hand in hand. It is beautiful, in a way.
Speak to the Innkeeper
Return to Lilian d'Ogremont
Mysteries of the Mycelium
Venture to Angry Earth shrines to collect samples of the white, stringy fungus Lilian described.
"Because you came back to life?"
Well, yes, that is always a pleasant surprise. But, no. \n\nI saw in this death-dream a great maze of white beneath this place. Under our very feet! It touches everything, connecting all that is.
"A maze of white what exactly?"

Fungus! Of course. Look at me. Mycophile. Silly thing.\n\nMycelium, I believe it is called. Dig a little in any old forest, and there you will find it. White. Stringy. Connected. Fetch me some, yes? You will see.
By your own hands, you will understand what my mind conjured for me. One of the great mysteries of this beautiful, fungal world.
Now do you understand?\n\nIt is like… little rivers of fungus, drawn together like a great fishing net, touching everything in this great old jungle. Connecting it!
"I even found some inside a bear."

Oh? What is this? It makes little sense to me. But these dryads, these creatures, they are not like us. Not flesh.\n\nWhat a mystery. A mycelius mystery. Something to ponder on. Thank you for this gift!
Forage for fungus within {POITags}
Dig for {itemName}
Forage for fungus within {POITags}
Dig for {itemName}
[NYI] Collect {itemName} from Dryad Bear
Medicinal Qualities
Collect medicinal herbs from Lough Du Lac swamp to help Sai Khanam recover from her wounds.
"It looks like you were attacked."
Not unscathed, I'm afraid. They came while we were resting and upended everything. It seemed as though they were searching for something.\n\nI am far from the outpost and these wounds are… worrying.
"Those cuts do look deep."

Oh… they are. If it were not for my companion, that would have been the end of me.\n\nI happen to know a little herb-lore, and I smell a swamp nearby. Can you collect some herbs for me? I will draw you a picture.
I am in no immediate danger, but I am in considerable pain. Any help you can offer is appreciated.
You found them! What fine specimens. The soil here must be very fertile. \n\nI will make a poultice. It will prevent infection and deal with some of this pain. I am in your debt.
Enter the swamp Lough Du Lac in search of herbs
Gather {itemName}
Thieves in the Night
Find and retrieve Sai Khanam's stolen belongings.
"Were they looking for something?"

It seems that way, doesn't it? I cannot fathom what I could have in my possession that would interest a dryad.\n\nRegardless, I cannot continue my journey without my things. Can you recover them for me?
It was very dark when they came, but I believe they ran to the west of here, up the slope behind me. Thank you again for your aid.
Ah! You found them! And mostly intact, too. Did the wolf come with you?
Follow the trail to collect Sai's stolen belongings
Seek the rest of Sai's things from {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Here, Boy!
Help Sai Khanam track down her wolf companion.
"Strangely how?"
After you left, he turned to me and simply plucked my bow out of my hands with his teeth! It caught me off guard, and by the time I thought to chase him, he was gone.\n\nCould you find him for me?
We have not traveled together long, but already I cannot imagine going on without him. I hope this is not the end of our companionship.
Hello, human. I am afraid I cannot return my companion's bow to you.
"Wait. You can talk?"
Obviously. I am called Scout.\n\nI commend your tracking skills, and without a nose like mine. Well done.
Follow the trail the "Dog" left in the mud
Enter {POITags} in search of Sai's companion
Defeat {targetName}
Find the "Dog"
Scout's Big Secret
Return to Sai Khanam and give her the totem Scout gave you.
"I did not come for the bow."
You are not? Ah… Sai must be worried about me.\n\nWhat a strange thing, to be bound to one of your kind. Our aims are so often opposed.
"Will you return to her?"
…Yes, I will return to her. We have weathered many storms together.\n\nBut she will need more protection than I can offer. Deliver her this charm… and say nothing of my voice. Please.
Please do not share the fact that I can speak with her. I will tell her, in my own time and my own way.
He came back! And-- what is this carving? Did you make this?\n\nI will cherish this, as I cherish him. I suppose I should finally choose a name for him, eh?
"How about… Scout?"
Scout… that DOES ring true, doesn't it? You are very good. Scout it is.\n\nI cannot thank you enough for reuniting us, stranger. You have a place at my fire, should you ever need one.
Deliver the totem to Sai Khanam
The Work You Undid
Replant the medicinal herbs you stole to their proper place within Lough Du Lac.
"Your garden? You mean this swamp?"

I suppose it would look like a swamp to one such as yourself. Damp, smells of mold, and rampant with life. Offensive to human noses, no doubt.\n\nNo matter. I would have you restore the herbs that you stole.
We have little to say to one another until you have completed the task at hand.
I will say this about your kind; You are remarkably efficient.\n\nI know your customs. You expect a reward of coin in exchange for the work of your hands. Consider it done.
Enter the swamp {POITags} to replace the stolen herbs
Replant the stolen herbs
Waiting on the Wind
Now that the wind is right, climb to the top of the bridge Avernal Verdure and burst the plant bulbs to release their pollen.
"I'm interested."
I keep an aerial garden above the canopy, just east of here. You can find it atop a crumbling bridge.\n\nThe wind is right to burst the bulbs I have cultivated. The smallest pressure will do.
You can use your feet to burst them, if it pleases you.
I can see from the pollen on your boots that the deed is done. Soon all of Edengrove will become my garden.\n\nHere is your payment, human.
Seek out the plant bulbs atop the bridge {POITags}
Pop blossoms to release their pollen
Even Greater Heights
Help Hedera expand her garden by climbing the ruins and planting a flower seed at its highest point.
"What am I climbing?"

To the point. Efficient, as I said.\n\nThere are ruins atop the rise to the north. It is one of the highest points in Edengrove. Ascend the stone and nestle this seedling amongst the cracks at its pinnacle.
Try not to fall. Your bones are fragile, I have heard.

In time, the bloom will mature and the wind will carry its scent far and wide. It is a species I have cultivated from my own body. A point of pride for my kind.\n\nI am finished with your services. Take your reward.
Ascend to the ruins to plant a seed at its highest point
Plant a flower at the highest point
Hold Your Breath
Destroy the strange flowers clinging to the rocks, ideally without breathing in their scent.
[Cover your nose.]
Let me… gather my thoughts. Just hold on. I had it. It was right there.\n\nYes! Flowers. Big ones. Red. Do NOT breathe their scent.
"You seem disoriented."
Am I? I am! The moment I smelled that flower…\n\nJust get rid of them. Rip them up by their roots. Do it without breathing. No one else can suffer as I do.
Do. Not. Smell. The. Flowers.
How strange. They are gone, but the scent remains.\n\nDo you smell it? Are you afflicted too?!
"I don't smell anything."
Gods, how long is this going to last? You should go.\n\nI feel compelled to stay and if I am being honest, I do not think I could walk if I wanted to.
Enter Buggane Hedge to destroy the strange blooms
Destroy the strange blooms
A Dark Compulsion
Clear the path to the north and west to allow Ranger Yasin to pass unharmed to… wherever it is he is going.
"I'm sorry, find who?"
I know how it sounds. I hear myself. My feet will move me down this path either way. I can FEEL her, waiting.\n\nHow do I know this? Sahal! Wake yourself!
"You're not dreaming."

I would have more control of myself in a dream!

I am going down that path. My sword arm will not lift. I can SEE it. It is already written.

If you care for a ranger's life, please clear the way for me.
It is taking every ounce of will I have to stay here. Please, clear the way.

Where is she? I am here! I saw it in my mind!

Ranger, shake yourself out of it.

Just… hold a moment. Let me think. Let me breathe.
Defeat {targetName} to clear the path
Meet Ranger Yasin near the stone bridge
Crying Out for Love
Ascend the rise and light a bonfire to help signal Ranger Yasin's presence to his "love."
"Hold on. Your LOVE?"
I am speaking to you with all the sincerity in my heart.\n\nIf I do not find her, I will die. I know it, like I know my own name. My heart will shatter in my chest.
"Well, when you put it that way."
A pyre! A grand conflagration! A beacon that will shine over all of Edengrove!\n\nGo and raise a fire atop the nearest rise. My love will see it, and she will come. It is written.
She will see it, and she will come. She will see it, and she will come!\n\nShe must…
Move aside! Surely she must--\n\n
"I was attacked. This is a trap."

The blaze was so bright! Surely it shone for miles! How could she forsake me now?

No. It is I who have failed her.

Please go, now.
Ascend the rise and signal to Ranger Yasin's "Love"

Out of His Misery
Speak to the dryad Hedera to find a way to rid Ranger Yasin of his affliction.
"I don't think you do either."
My feet are bound to this spot as a tree is rooted to the earth. I can do nothing to change my fate… but you can.\n\nFind her. Find my love, and beg her to end this torment. Please.
I feel wretched. Like my heart is being rent from my chest. Please, hurry.
Ah. You lived. Thank you for dealing with that nuisance.\n\nI believe I owe you coin, as per your custom.
"Your flowers killed him."
You helped. Efficiently, at that.\n\nAllow me to illuminate something for you, in addition to your payment. Your kind are not welcome here. Begone.

Allez à Éridan récupérer des morceaux de bois d'Azoth enchanté du yeoman d'Éridan.
« On a tous besoin d'un bon arc. »
Oui, si on a de bons yeux, ce qui semble être votre cas, puisque vous m'avez repérée. \n\nCet arc est le puissant Torrent, un arc légendaire pour les pisteurs. Obtenez ces objets et il sera à vous.
Le Torrent suscite l'envie de tous les archers d'Aeternum.\n\nUne arme sans pareille, je crois.

Alors, vous avez tout ? Un tendon d'un autre monde, un os ancien, une couche d'huile, et une corde parfaite... pour une arme parfaite ! \n\nPrenez cet arc, le Torrent, et tenez-le avec fierté. C'est une classe à part entière.

« On dit que les mousquets, c'est votre truc. »

Il n'y a pas de sensation plus grisante que celle d'un mousquet en main. Le pouvoir du feu, de l'acier et de la science.\n\nVous aurez peut-être même l'occasion de fabriquer une arme à feu tout à fait unique, si vous le souhaitez.
« Ça m'intéresse beaucoup. »
J'ai surnommé ce mousquet « Voix bruyante », car ses tirs font un sacré boucan.\n\nApportez les pièces nécessaires à la pisteuse Madaki et nous pourrons vous fabriquer une arme à feu incomparable.
Madaki a les plans. Vous n'avez plus qu'à fournir les pièces.
Vous avez récupéré les pièces pour Voix bruyante. \n\nTrès bien, alors vous allez l'avoir... Le meilleur mousquet que le monde n'ait jamais connu. Maniez-le avec fierté.

La Réforme
« Vous savez comment la forger ? »
Oui. Les altérés appellent cette création « la Réforme », et bien que je les méprise, j'aime ce nom.\n\nRécupérez les composants de cette liste et rapportez-les à Madaki. Alors la Réforme sera vôtre.
Avez-vous déjà remarqué l'odeur des altérés ? \n\nC'est comme un mélange d'odeur de soufre et de fruits pourris. Épouvantable.

Parfait, vous avez récupéré les composants pour la hache double. \n\nBien joué ! Voici une hache vouée à abattre de nombreux altérés. Maniez-la avec fureur, {playerName}. Donnez-leur quelque chose à craindre.

Échec et mat de la tour
Rassemblez les composants nécessaires à la fabrication du bouclier légendaire, la Défense de la tour.
L'ouverture classique et la disposition de l'échiquier du jeu indien qui inspirera plus tard les échecs. Votre ouverture se joue à Malveillance.
Dans cette partie d'échecs mortelle, les pièces d'ivoire bougent en premier. Votre premier mouvement est vers Scorpion.
La capacité du pion à s'élancer vers les lignes de front dès son premier tour est redoutable. Votre prochain déplacement vous conduira à Éridan.
L'histoire perse du Shahnameh, la reconstitution d'une bataille épique sur un échiquier. Votre combat continue à Periville.
Une fois qu'une pièce a été touchée sur l'échiquier, elle doit être déplacée. Votre prochain objectif vous mène à la forteresse du Crâne de pierre.
Si un pion parvient à atteindre l'autre côté du plateau en vie, il sera sacré dame. Votre couronnement intervient à Caminus.
Le roque est un mouvement aux échecs au cours duquel le roi se déplace de deux cases vers une tour, puis la tour se déplace vers le roi pour le protéger. Roquez-vous dans les Monts difformes.
Une annonce selon laquelle le roi de l'autre joueur a été placé en position périlleuse. Examinez les altérés d'Opulence.
« Vous savez comment la forger ? »

Oui. L'utilisation d'un bouclier, et d'un bouclier comme celui-ci requiert une stratégie à part entière.\n\nC'est comme un jeu auquel j'ai joué une fois et qui s'appelle « les échecs ». Ce bouclier est la tour qui défend votre roi.
« Comment le créer ? »
Trouvez ces composants et apportez-les à Madaki. Elle est le maître de la Forge.\n\nRapportez-lui ces éléments, et Madaki pourra vous accorder la « Défense de la Tour ».
Je n'ai jamais vu de bouclier aussi redoutable que la Défense de la tour.\n\nEnfin, si vous réussissez à convaincre Madaki de le forger, bien sûr.
Vous avez rondement bien joué en récupérant ces composants.\n\nVous avez bien mérité la Défense de la tour, et vous l'utiliserez sans aucun doute avec autant de bravoure. Échec et mat, effectivement.

Can I read you my latest poem? It's only 200 lines.\n\nAndeolus says my skills are improving. But Joan says she'd rather lose her right arm than hear another line.
"Umm…sure, read it."
To stay in Aeternum is to live as an eternal To accept sorrow is to live as an infernal. \n\nTo wake up in the morning is to live as a diurnal

You look learned. I humor Milosh but he has to work on himself and ahem…his poetry, a bit more. \n\nLuckily for him, I've read Meditations and learnt how to accept the shortcomings of those who aren't as gifted as I am.

Can I trust you or will you disappear as soon as you get what you want from me? Like my family did. \n\nMilosh wants me to hear his poetry. Andeolus wants me to make him look smart. I'm just looking for people who won't leave me.

If you see an Auberon Gowering, tell him Tello is onto him and won't rest till he avenges his friends. \n\nHe sold the mine to the Corrupted to line his pockets. And now he cries over what happened? He's a damned fool!
Do you know how to escape the island safely? I've heard stories of storms at sea and cursed ships, how no one survives.

If everything is an illusion, why do we make an effort to hide the truth? \n\nI used to make wigs to cover up baldness once. Mousy brown. Now? I help people express who they truly are; every color of the rainbow.
Who needs a husband when you have wealth of your own? \n\nA few gems to buy a house, a few more to hire a pair of handsome guards. Life is good.

Hellooo! Are you paying attention? I am looking for an adventurer to write songs about, one that doesn't hunt dryads, like my last one did. \n\nDryads are such exquisite creatures. To hurt one is nothing short of uncultured.
Isn't Yadira divine? Her smile is like the sun bordering the horizon. Fleeting, but it fills my soul with joy. \n\nTo see her is to experience God. To kiss her is to be reborn.

Yadira is a practical woman. And my brother is a dreamer. The two would never work out. \n\nWhat she needs is a strong man. A man of the earth. Like me. If only my brother would admit it and get out of our way.
Have you seen Auberon? He's a good man. Was a good father. \n\nWe lost our sons to the Angry Earth. He blames himself for not being able to buy them the armor they needed.

Stay wary of Auberon. He is a conniving snake who has fooled my sister. \n\nThe Angry Earth wouldn't have attacked the mines, if he hadn't agitated them. The Corrupted? Ask around and you'll find the truth about that.
Hmm…stay wary of dangers.
Hmm…stay alert and don't die.
The Pioneer's Lament
Help a doomed farmer move on with his life.
Help, oh god, please help me.
« Qu'y a-t-il ? »

Forgive me, I’ve made a horrible, horrible mistake. I tried to start a farm in Edengrove. I moved my family here. We were to harvest paradise. Fool! \n\nThe Angry Earth didn’t take kindly to their new neighbors.
"What happened next?"

We were overrun. My entire family rendered Lost. All my fault. If I don’t get back to work I fear I will share the same fate. But all my equipment is back at the farm, and I haven’t the mettle to return. Could you recover it?
Go to my farm, fight off the Angry Earth who have claimed it, and retrieve my farming equipment. And perhaps some token of my family. I am a broken, lonely man.
You found my equipment, thank god. But what’s this? A letter from my son? He says he’s raising a farm in Ebonscale Reach, the brave, resourceful lad.
“He survived the attack after all.”
All is not lost! I shall reunite with him straight away. Thank you for delivering this news, you have saved me from the brink.
Go to {POITags}
Search the farm for Abiathar's equipment
Heart Beats Hate
Harvest the heart of Aeternum's angriest Dryad Brute, for science.
Have a heart for science?
"How can I help?"

Ay, look at yon Dryad Brute. Just stares at that tower all day, seething. Fascinating. \n\n‘Balor the Belligerent,’ I call him. I’ve never seen a creature so consumed with hatred. How I’d love to peek into his heart.
"Why his heart?"
It would tell me a great deal about what makes the Angry Earth so damn angry. Think you could manage such an excision?
There’s a Dryad Brute called Balor the Belligerent. I need his heart. His beautiful, hate-filled heart. Kill him and bring it to me, if you would be so kind.
You have the heart, do you? Very resourceful. Look at that, pumping rage and venom. Once I distill it I’ll be capable of the same.
"Wait, I thought he was evil?"
Oh, yes. It’s for a rage potion of my own. Why else would I be wanting his heart, now? I just need to figure how to brew it without blowing myself to bits in the process. Wish me luck.
Go to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and harvest his heart
Art is Suffering
Deface an avant-garde sculptress's embarrassing early work.
"Can I help you?"
Ahem. Like all great artists, I was in a state of deep meditation. Creativity means surrender, not control. It took me centuries to learn that.
“Evolving as an artist is natural.”

Truly. I’ve found my artistic calling, but it took centuries of chiseling out dross. Pity that marble is such a timeless medium. I’d destroy my early work if I could, but my old work space is teeming with Angry Earth now.
"You should fight for your art."
I make art, not war. But you have the look of one who’s dealt their share of violence. Might I trouble you to spare my reputation and thrash up some old sculptures? It could be rather fun for you.
Dispose of some poorly aged sculptures from my formative years. They no longer accurately reflect my artistic voice, not to mention I used several ex-lovers as models. It’s all best forgotten.

All gone? Thank the Muses! Someday I shall memorialize your deeds in marble. \n\nI’m in my “Contra-Formic, Manneristic-Deconstructivism” period, so expect to see an arbitrary number of limbs and a loose sense of shape.
Care to support the arts?
Go to {POITags}
Destroy the embarrassing sculpture
Destroy the sophomoric sculpture
Destroy the poorly aged sculpture
Destroy the amateurish sculpture
Destroy the mediocre sculpture
Isn't this place beautiful? Like the scents of the first rain of the season. \n\nThe colours here are so vivid, it reminds me of the time I had with my mum.
"Can you talk to the plants too?"

Yes, the plants are speaking, even though I can't understand their words. Maybe their emotions? \n\nHaha. If we can talk to plants, can we talk to anything? And if we can talk to anything, are we ever alone?
"What did your mum want you to see?"
My mum probably wanted me to feel how we're all connected. \n\nEdengrove can feel a bit cold and distant. But here, with these talking plants? It's almost like we're friends. We are friends!
Wyldwood Water
Find Wyldwood Water recipe for Antara

Doesn't life seem endless sometimes? My mum and I used to sit on the tallest cliffs, our legs dangling over the edge, teasing death. \n\nShe was so adventurous. So indomitable. I miss her. And I don't know if I'll ever measure up to what she was.
"You can leave your own mark."

Hah. I only want to continue my mother's legacy. I want to find the potion she said would help us see the world as it really is. \n\nBased on our research, the Dryads should have it here. Will you help me find it?
Did you find the recipe? \n\nIt should be in one of the chests on this bridge.
Wonderful! I can’t believe it. You found the recipe for Wyldwood Water! \n\nI wish my mother would be here to see this.
Go to Avernal Verdure
Get recipe for Wyldwood Water
Get lore for Wyldwood Water
Everywhere Friends
Get Wyldwood Water ingredients for Antara
Here's the Wyldwood Water. Doesn't it have a strange sheen, as if there's something living in its depths? \n\nI don't know the exact effects of drinking it.
"As an immortal, I like taking risks."
Hah, clever! Yes, we can't really die on this island. And you seem to have enough spirit to keep from turning Lost. \n\nReady, then? Let's have the Wyldwood Water and see what happens.
How are you feeling? \n\nDo you notice anything different about the nature around you?
I'm glad you're here with me. \n\nI guess the universe works in strange ways and I'm lucky you came to the bridge when you did.

Hear Plant 3
I'll always remember you. I wish I'd met you before. I think mum would have liked you.
(The colors rich, the strokes indulgent, a rendering of Edengrove that can only be described as abstract. \n\nClearly, the artist was lost in his thoughts.)
(The colors rich, the strokes indulgent, a rendering of Edengrove that can only be described as abstract. \n\nClearly, the artist was lost in his thoughts.)

What do you think of the art that surrounds us? Some would say the sight is almost breathtaking. \n\nBut when you're a true artist, you see every color, every shape without attaching any emotion to it. I miss being a plebian.
Incomparable Blue
Find painter Wolcott
"Study painting."
(The painting has been signed by a P. Wolcott. \n\nUpon closer inspection, there's a note asking for it to be returned if found.)
(The painting has been signed by a P. Wolcott. \n\nUpon closer inspection, there's a note asking for it to be returned if found.)
Ah! That is my painting. You have passed my test to find a genuine appreciator of fine art. \n\nMy artistic endeavors require assistance. The kind only a fellow soul can undertake.
"Would we draw together?"
Maybe someday. When I have ascertained you've reached the desired artistic level. \n\nTo start, could you bring me a blue to match the surreal cerulean of Edengrove?
What a gorgeous blue! It's so close to the shade I imagined. \n\nMaybe you do have the makings of an artist, if you ever choose to drop the sword and pick up a brush instead, which seems unlikely.
You have done well, friend. Thank you for finding me this most glorious blue. \n\nI hope I can count on you if I need to collaborate for any future creative pursuits. Till then, toodaloo!
